q: Robert King , who produces the show with his wife Michelle, said he wanted Donald Rumsfeld to appear as a witness in a lawsuit, testifying about why aggressive interrogation techniques like water-boarding are sometimes needed during wartime. It's an episode about moral relativism about what is considered torture and what is not, Robert King said. But Keith Urbahn , who works for the former defense secretary, said the idea rules Donald Rumsfeld out.`` This area is so fraught with legal ramifications,'' Keith Urbahn said.``

, a lot of academics like to have meetings. And they like to bridge differences and get people all to be happy.'' He also disputed any notion that Mr. Colin Powell was anti-war. I never saw even the slightest hint of that. The idea that he was lying or duped is nonsense, Mr. Donald Rumsfeld told Ms. Diane Sawyer . In his book, Mr. Donald Rumsfeld also takes aim at a man still looming large on the national political stage- Arizona Sen. John McCain , a longtime thorn in his side.
